title: The College Dropout Who Took Merrill Lynch Global
sub_head: David Komansky led the Wall Street firmâ€™s overseas expansion and helped it step into the digital age
body:
David Komansky dabbled as an electrician and spent some time in the Coast Guard before he found his true calling: Wall Street.
The young Mr. Komansky, a college dropout, started as a trainee at a Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith outpost in Queens, N.Y., in 1968. Twenty-eight years later, he was running the firm.
